headline.main: FROM EUROPE.; State of the London Money Market, The Cotton, Provision and Breadstuffs Trade. Condition of Affairs in Italy. ARRIVAL OF THE SAXONIA. INTERESTING FROM OUR FOREIGN FILES,

docs.lead_paragraph: The stearnship Saxonia, of the Hamburg line, H. EHLERS Con:mander, from Southampton Aug. 4, arrived at this port yesterday, in the afternoon. We are thus placed in possession of London papers to the morning of the 4th inst., the date to which our telegraphic advices by the City of Baltimore extended. The feeling with regard to the immediate prospects of foreign politics was more favorable.

docs.snippet: The members of the Croton Board returned tom their examination of the lake and other sources of our water yesterday, without having arrived at any other conclusion of the present bad taste and smell of it than that which resulted from the examination...

headline.main: THE PECULIARITIES OF THE CROTON.; The Subject Discussed in the Academy of Medicine. Present Condition of the Croton Water Accounted for, and its Harmlessness set forth. Ridgewood Water Imported from Brooklyn. RETURN OF THE MEMBERS OF THE CROTON BOARD

docs.lead_paragraph: The members of the Croton Board returned tom their examination of the lake and other sources of our water yesterday, without having arrived at any other conclusion of the present bad taste and smell of it than that which resulted from the examination by the Assistant Engineer. It is believed now that should the weather continue fair, the water will soon taste and smell as sweetly as before.

docs.snippet: REGULAR MEETING OF THE YOUNG MEN'S REPUBLICAN CENTRAL COMMITTEE--RESIGNATION OF POLICEMEN--The Monthly Meeting of the Republication Young Men's Central Committee was held last night at No. 618 Broadway. The names of one or more members from each...
docs.lead_paragraph: REGULAR MEETING OF THE YOUNG MEN'S REPUBLICAN CENTRAL COMMITTEE--RESIGNATION OF POLICEMEN--The Monthly Meeting of the Republication Young Men's Central Committee was held last night at No. 618 Broadway. The names of one or more members from each Ward, who had forfeited their membership by violating the constitution in absenting themselves from two successive meetings of the Committee, were read by the Chairman of the Committee on Vacancies.

docs.snippet: BOARD OF HEALTH.--An adjourned meeting of the Brooklyn Board of Health was held yesterday. Several small nuisances were ordered abated; severe large nuisances were referred for special report. Mr. JOHN T. HILDRETH, the great leader of the opposition...
docs.lead_paragraph: BOARD OF HEALTH.--An adjourned meeting of the Brooklyn Board of Health was held yesterday. Several small nuisances were ordered abated; severe large nuisances were referred for special report. Mr. JOHN T. HILDRETH, the great leader of the opposition to swill milk, was present, to look after a communication which he sent in a few weeks ago, complaining of HUSTED'S swill-milk stables on Franklin-avenue.

headline.main: MADISON UNIVERSITY COMMENCEMENT.; Dr. Eaton's Baccalaureate--Dr. Williams, of New-York, addresses the Society for Inquiry--Interesting Exercises on the Departure of Young Missionaries--The Poet, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Annual Commencement of Madison University is now fully under way. The usual number of visitors are crowding in, and the week promises to be most lively. The exercises were introduced at 1 1/2 o'clock cn Sunday, P. M., with the Baccalaureate Sermon, by Rev. GEO. W. EATON, D. D,, President of the University. Ills subject was " Individual Accountability,"

docs.snippet: Th Richmond Grays were yesterday the recipients of another ovation. The Second and Fifth Companies of the National Guard, commanded respectively by Captains SHALER and SPRIGHT, formed into line about 2 o'clock in Lafayette-place, and marched thence...

headline.main: CIVIC BANQUET TO THE RICHMOND GRAYS.; Speeches of Mayor Mayo, of Richmond, Mayor Tiemann, of New-York, and the Representatives of our City Authorities.

docs.lead_paragraph: Th Richmond Grays were yesterday the recipients of another ovation. The Second and Fifth Companies of the National Guard, commanded respectively by Captains SHALER and SPRIGHT, formed into line about 2 o'clock in Lafayette-place, and marched thence through Broadway to the Brandreth House, in front of which the Richmond Grays were drawn up to receive them.

docs.snippet: The Hill-Country of Connecticut-Brookfield and its Surroundings. Correspondence of the New-York Times. BROOKFIELD, Tuesday, Aug. 9, 1859. I wonder why it is that there is so much ignorance among our city people of the "hillcountry" of Connecticut.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Hill-Country of Connecticut-Brookfield and its Surroundings. Correspondence of the New-York Times. BROOKFIELD, Tuesday, Aug. 9, 1859. I wonder why it is that there is so much ignorance among our city people of the "hillcountry" of Connecticut.

docs.lead_paragraph: " Occasional" writes from Washington to the Philadelphia Press: "The Administration Democrats of Texas have had a severe contest against 'Old San Jacinto,' and have been whipped. The candidate who ran against Gen. HOUSTON was regularly nominated, and ran open the platform of Mr. BUCHANAN, and yet, in the Constitution of this morning there is an article claiming that Gen.

docs.snippet: Having waited many days, in the hope of joining a party sufficiently strong to contend with the robbers between Vera Cruz and the City of Mexico, and no such opportunity offering, your correspondent concluded to run the gauntlet solo, and take such...

headline.main: AFFAIRS IN MEXICO.; Graphic Picture of the Condition of the Country. Narrative of a Journey from Vera Cruz to the Capital--Encounter with Robbers--Sediment of the Spanish and Indian Races in the "Pagan District"--General Condition of the Country--Incidents of Travel. Description of the " Pagan District."

docs.lead_paragraph: Having waited many days, in the hope of joining a party sufficiently strong to contend with the robbers between Vera Cruz and the City of Mexico, and no such opportunity offering, your correspondent concluded to run the gauntlet solo, and take such chances as might fall to his lot.

docs.snippet: WHAT IS THE MATTER WITH THE CROTON?--Citizens of New-York do not know what a blessing they enjoy from year to sear in their pure water until the Croton becomes rily and brackish for a day or two. Then noses are turned up, and the water must be...
docs.lead_paragraph: WHAT IS THE MATTER WITH THE CROTON?--Citizens of New-York do not know what a blessing they enjoy from year to sear in their pure water until the Croton becomes rily and brackish for a day or two. Then noses are turned up, and the water must be flavored with peppermint, of course, to make it drinkable. Just now every one,
